SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.aoplib4j.failurehandling
Annotation Type RetryExecution

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface RetryExecution

Annotation to be used on methods for handling execution failure. If the method execution throws an instance of exceptionToCatch() the method is re-executed until the execution succeeds or the number of re-executions ismaxRetry(). If waitTime() is bigger than zero then the current thread will wait(sleep) waitTime() milliseconds between two consecutive executions.

Author:
Adrian Citu

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> exceptionToCatch
          The exception to catch that will trigger a re-execution.
 int maxRetry
          The number of times the method should be re-executed if the execution throws an instance of exceptionToCatch().
 
Optional Element Summary
 long waitTime
          The time to wait between 2 executions.
 

Element Detail

maxRetry

public abstract int maxRetry
The number of times the method should be re-executed if the execution throws an instance of exceptionToCatch().

exceptionToCatch

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> exceptionToCatch
The exception to catch that will trigger a re-execution.

waitTime

public abstract long waitTime
The time to wait between 2 executions.

Default:
0L
